intro: Huanaca bergii, commonly known as the Andean moonflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its large, white, night-blooming flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically green when unripe and turn red when mature. Huanaca bergii is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments and thrives in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and traditional contexts.
